form.longName: PhenX PX520402 - Expectancies Alcohol Tobacco And Other Substances Illegal Stimulant Drugs
form.preferredDefinition: The Stimulant Effect Expectancy Questionnaire (SEEQ) is a modification of the Cocaine Effect Expectancy Questionnaire that assesses stimulants in general, rather than cocaine only. Subjects are asked to answer 71 questions regarding the stimulant with which they are most familiar and according to their beliefs about the stimulant drug they "know best." The SEEQ assesses 5 scales - Global Positive Effects, Global Negative Effects, General Arousal, Anxiety, and Relaxation with Tension Reduction. A shorter version of the SEEQ contains 46 items across the same 5 scales (4â€“14 items per scale).

headerInstruction.text: The following questions contain statements about the effects of stimulants, including cocaine and amphetamines (crystal meth, speed). Read each statement carefully and respond according to your own personal thoughts, feelings, and beliefs abou..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Expectancies - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substances - Illegal Stimulant Drugs
module.preferredDefinition: Expectancies - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substances - Illegal Stimulant Drugs

question.questionText: Which stimulant drug do you have the most experience with or knowledge about? (check a box) (which_stimulant_drug_most_experience)

Please fill out the following questions according to your beliefs about the stimulant drug you know best. PLEASE BE HONEST. REMEMBER, YOUR ANSWERS ARE CONFIDENTIAL. RESPOND TO THESE ITEMS ACCORDING TO WHAT YOU PERSONNALLY BELIEVE TO BE TRUE ABOUT A MODERATE AMOUNT OF STIMULANTS HOWEVER YOU DEFINE MODERATECheck the box which shows how much you agree or disagree with each item: (info2_520402)
1. Stimulants make me less hungry. (stimulants_make_me_less_hungry)
2. Stimulants increase my sex drive. (stimulants_increase_my_sex_drive)
3. I say things that I don't mean when I am on stimulants. (say_things_dont_mean_stimulants)
4. find the effects of stimulants are not similar to those of alcohol. (effects_not_similar_to_alcohol)
5. I am anxious or tense when I am on stimulants. (anxious_or_tense_stimulants)
6. Stimulants speed me up. (stimulants_speed_me_up)
7. Stimulants make me feel dreamy and mellow. (stimulants_make_me_feel_dreamy)
8. Stimulants make me shaky. (stimulants_make_me_shaky)
9. I can get paranoid when I am on stimulants. (get_paranoid_on_stimulants)
10. When I am on stimulants I feel as though everything is right in the world. (everything_is_right_stimulants)
11. I do not become impatient and agitated when I am on stimulants. (not_impatient_stimulants)
12. Stimulants make me 'hyper' (overactive, overtalkative, etc.). (stimulants_make_me_hyper)
13. Stimulants give me an uncomfortable feeling inside my stomach. (stimulants_uncomfortable_feeling)
14. Stimulants give me a 'rush', or a sudden sense of being 'swept away'. (stimulants_give_rush)
15. Stimulants increase my activity level. (stimulants_increase_activity_level)
16. I grind my teeth when I am on stimulants. (grind_teeth_on_stimulants)
17. Stimulants make my heart beat faster and cause the blood to rush around inside my body. (stimulants_make_my_heart_faster)
18. I become numb on stimulants. (numb_on_stimulants)
19. I go to the bathroom more when I am on stimulants. (bathroom_more_on_stimulants)
20. I become awake and alert when I am on stimulants. (awake_and_alert_on_stimulants)
21. I get a tingly feeling when I am on stimulants. (tingly_feeling_on_stimulants)
22. I am more capable of getting things done when I am on stimulants. (more_capable_on_stimulants)
23. Stimulants make me feel more important. (stimulants_make_me_feel_important)
24. I am not easily frustrated when I am on stimulants. (not_easily_frustrated_on_stimulants)
25. Stimulants make me feel as though I am on top of things. (stimulants_feel_on_top)
26. Stimulants do not make me lightheaded or dizzy. (stimulants_not_dizzy)
27. I am less sensitive to other people when I am on stimulants. (less_sensitive_on_stimulants)
28. Stimulants make me feel like I can do anything. (can_do_anything_stimulants)
29. I have difficulty focusing on one thing at a time when I am on stimulants. (difficulty_focusing_stimulants)
30. Stimulants do not make things seem clear. (stimulants_do_not_make_clear)
31. Stimulants do not make me sweat. (stimulants_do_not_make_sweat)
32. After the stimulant 'high' is over, I become depressed or 'burned out'. (after_stimulant_depressed)
33. Stimulants decrease my sexual performance. (stimulants_decrease_my_sexual_performance)
34. Stimulants make me do the same thing over and over again. (same_thing_over_stimulants)
35. I am never satisfied when I am on stimulants I always want more. (never_satisfied_on_stimulants)
36. I am less aware of reality when I am on stimulants. (less_aware_on_stimulants)
37. Stimulants give me a sense of being in control. (stimulants_give_sense_of_control)
38. Stimulants cause hallucinations. (stimulants_cause_hallucinations)
39. Stimulants cause me to lose interest in what I am doing. (stimulants_cause_me_lose_interest)
40. Stimulants make my judgment worse. (stimulants_make_my_judgment_worse)
41. I am able to drink a lot more without getting drunk when I am on stimulants. (able_to_drink_more_stimulants)
42. I am more talkative when I am on stimulants. (more_talkative_stimulants)
43. I become fearful on stimulants. (become_fearful_on_stimulants)
44. Stimulants make me aggressive and dominating. (stimulants_make_me_aggressive)
45. Parties are more fun when I am on stimulants. (parties_more_fun_on_stimulants)
46. Stimulants make me feel very happy. (stimulants_make_me_happy)

ScorScoring Procedure and Interpretation :The 46 items of the Stimulant Effect Expectancy Questionnaire (SEEQ) comprise the following 5 scales (Aarons et al., 2001): 1) Global Positive Effects: items 2, 10, 22, 23, 25, 28, 37, 44, 45, and 46 (2) Global Negative Effects: items 3, 8, 9, 27, 29, 32, 33, 34, 35, 36, 38, 39, 40, and 43 (3) General Arousal: items 6, 12, 14, 15, 17, 20, 21, and 42 (4) Anxiety: items 1, 4, 5, 13, 16, 18, 19, and 41(5) Relaxation and Tension Reduction: items 7, 11, 24, and 31 The score for each scale is calculated by averaging the item scores, i.e., totaling the item scores and dividing by the number of items in the scale. Each item is scored on a 1 to 5 scale (Disagree Strongly = 1 and Agree Strongly = 5). Of note, items 26 and 30 are not scored. The scoring scheme reflects factors identified in the original publications. Factor structure may differ in individual studiesing Procedure and Interpretation (scoring_520402)

protocol.longName: Expectancies - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substances - Illegal Stimulant Drugs
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Stimulant Effect Expectancy Questionnaire (SEEQ) is a modification of the Cocaine Effect Expectancy Questionnaire that assesses stimulants in general, rather than cocaine only. Subjects are asked to answer 71 questions regarding the stimulant with which they are most familiar and according to their beliefs about the stimulant drug they "know best." The SEEQ assesses 5 scales - Global Positive Effects, Global Negative Effects, General Arousal, Anxiety, and Relaxation with Tension Reduction. A shorter version of the SEEQ contains 46 items across the same 5 scales (4â€“14 items per scale).

form.longName: PhenX PX520304 - Selfreported Craving Specific Marijuana
form.preferredDefinition: The Marijuana Craving Questionnaire - Short Form (MCQ-SF) consists of 12 statements about the respondent's feelings and thoughts about smoking marijuana as he or she is completing the questionnaire (i.e., right now).

headerInstruction.text: Indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with each of the following statements by selecting a number between 1 (STRONGLY DISAGREE) and 7 (STRONGLY AGREE). The closer your selection to one end or the other indicates the strength of your agre..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: 1. Smoking marijuana would be pleasant right now. (marijuana_pleasant_right_now)
2. I could not easily limit how much marijuana I smoked right now. (could_not_limit_marijuana)
3. Right now, I am making plans to use marijuana. (making_plans_for_marijuana)
4. I would feel more in control of things right now if I could smoke marijuana. (more_in_control_marijuana)
5. Smoking marijuana would help me sleep better at night. (marijuana_sleep_better)
6. If I smoked marijuana right now, I would feel less tense. (marijuana_less_tense)
7. I would not be able to control how much marijuana I smoked if I had some here. (unable_control_how_much_marijuana)
8. It would be great to smoke marijuana right now. (great_to_smoke_marijuana)
9. I would feel less anxious if I smoked marijuana right now. (less_anxious_marijuana)
10. I need to smoke marijuana now. (need_marijuana)
11. If I were smoking marijuana right now, I would feel less nervous. (marijuana_less_nervous)
12. Smoking marijuana would make me content. (marijuana_would_make_me_content)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation *Compulsivity: Mean of items 2, 7, and 10 *Emotionality: Mean of items 4, 6, and 9 *Expectancy: Mean of items 5, 11, and 12 *Purposefulness: Mean of items 1, 3, and 8 *Total score: Sum of means for the 4 subscales.The scoring scheme reflects factors identified in the original publications. Factor structure may differ in individual studies (scoring_520304)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Marijuana Craving Questionnaire - Short Form (MCQ-SF) consists of 12 statements about the respondent's feelings and thoughts about smoking marijuana as he or she is completing the questionnaire (i.e., right now).

form.preferredDefinition: The respondent is asked a single question from the Semi-Structured Assessment for the Genetics of Alcoholism, Version IV (C-SSAGA-A-IV), about their craving to drink alcohol or use drugs.

question.questionText: **Note: The Working Group recommends the word "drink" in the question below can be replaced with "use [insert name of drug of interest]." (general_520305)
At times when you couldn't drink, did you ever want to drink so badly that you couldn't think of anything else? (drink_couldnt_think_anything_else)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The respondent is asked a single question from the Semi-Structured Assessment for the Genetics of Alcoholism, Version IV (C-SSAGA-A-IV), about their craving to drink alcohol or use drugs.

form.longName: PhenX PX520404 - Expectancies Alcohol Tobacco And Other Substances Marijuana
form.preferredDefinition: The Marijuana Effect Expectancy Questionnaire (MEEQ) contains 78 items that describe the effects of marijuana on respondents. Respondents are asked to rate their experiences on a 5-point Likert scale to indicate agreement or disagreement. The MEEQ has 6 scales (6â€“13 items per scale) - Cognitive and Behavioral Impairment, Relaxation and Tension Reduction, Social and Sexual Facilitation, Perceptual and Cognitive Enhancement, Global Negative Effects, and Craving and Physical Effects. A shorter version of the MEEQ contains 48 items across the same 6 scales (6â€“10 items per scale).

headerInstruction.text: The following questions ask about the effects of marijuana. Read each question carefully and respond according to your own personal thoughts, feelings, and beliefs about marijuana now. We are interested in what you think about marijuana, regar..TRUNCATED

module.longName: Expectancies - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substances - Marijuana
module.preferredDefinition: Expectancies - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substances - Marijuana

question.questionText: 1. Marijuana makes small things seem intensely interesting. (marijuana_makes_small_things_interesting)
2. Smoking marijuana makes me hungry. (smoking_marijuana_makes_me_hungry)
3. Smoking marijuana increases my craving for things. (smoking_marijuana_increases_my_craving)
4. I get a sense of relaxation from smoking marijuana. (relaxation_from_smoking_marijuana)
5. Smoking marijuana makes me less tense or relieves anxiety it helps me to unwind. (marijuana_helps_me_to_unwind)
6. Marijuana makes me carefree, and I do not care about my problems as much. (marijuana_makes_me_carefree)
7. I am not concerned about how others evaluate me when I am on marijuana. (unconcerned_about_evaluation_marijuana)
8. Marijuana makes me talk more than usual. (marijuana_makes_me_talk_more)
9. I feel like I can focus on one thing better when I smoke marijuana. (can_focus_better_marijuana)
10. When I smoke marijuana I do not feel insecure. (marijuana_not_feel_insecure)
11. Marijuana makes me say things I do not mean. (marijuana_say_things_dont_mean)
12. I am more sociable when I smoke marijuana. (more_sociable_on_marijuana)
13. Smoking marijuana makes me feel like part of the group. (smoking_marijuana_makes_me_feel_like_part_of_the_group)
14. If I have been smoking marijuana, it is harder for me to concentrate and understand the meaning of what is being said. (marijuana_harder_to_concentrate_understand)
15. Marijuana slows thinking and actions. (marijuana_slows_thinking_actions)
16. I become more creative or imaginative on marijuana. (more_creative_on_marijuana)
17. If I have been smoking marijuana it is harder to remember things. (marijuana_harder_to_remember_things)
18. Things seem unreal and I feel out of touch with what is going on around me when I smoke marijuana. (unreal_outoftouch_marijuana)
19. When I smoke marijuana it helps me escape reality. (marijuana_escape_reality)
20. Marijuana makes me giggly and laugh a lot. (marijuana_makes_me_giggly)
21. When I smoke marijuana I feel like I have heavy feet and no coordination. (marijuana_heavy_feet)
22. Music sounds different when I smoke marijuana. (music_sounds_different_marijuana)
23. Marijuana tastes and smells bad. (marijuana_tastes_and_smells_bad)
24. I have a happy, good feeling when I smoke marijuana. (happy_feeling_marijuana)
25. Marijuana causes me to lose control and become careless. (marijuana_lose_control_careless)
26. Marijuana makes it easier to escape from problems and responsibilities. (marijuana_escape_problems_responsibilities)
27. I am less motivated when I smoke marijuana. (less_motivated_marijuana)
28. Marijuana can cause me to become depressed and disappointed with myself. (marijuana_depressed_and_disappointed)
29. Marijuana causes euphoria (strong sense of wellbeing). (marijuana_causes_euphoria)
30. Marijuana can make my feelings change from happy to sad. (marijuana_change_from_happy_to_sad)
31. I act excited when I smoke marijuana. (act_excited_marijuana)
32. Marijuana does not make me feel more romantic or attracted to members of the opposite sex. (marijuana_not_make_me_romantic)
33. After smoking marijuana my eyelids feel heavy and I become drowsy. (marijuana_eyelids_feel_heavy)
34. Marijuana can make me angry and possibly violent. (marijuana_makes_me_violent)
35. After the "high" of smoking marijuana I feel down. (after_marijuana_high_feel_down)
36. Marijuana does not alter my personality. (marijuana_does_not_alter_personality)
37. I feel sexy or more interested in sex after smoking marijuana. (feel_sexy_marijuana)
38. Marijuana makes me critical and shorttempered. (marijuana_makes_me_critical)
39. I get the "munchies" (craving for snacks) when I smoke marijuana. (get_munchies_marijuana)
40. It is difficult for me to express my thoughts clearly if I have been smoking marijuana. (difficult_express_thoughts_marijuana)
41. Marijuana makes my mouth seem dry. (marijuana_makes_mouth_dry)
42. Marijuana makes me calm. (marijuana_makes_me_calm)
43. Marijuana changes my perception of time and distance. (marijuana_changes_perception_time_distance)
44. I am more relaxed in social situations if I have been smoking marijuana. (more_relaxed_social_situations_marijuana)
45. I have a better time at parties if I am smoking marijuana. (better_time_parties_marijuana)
46. Marijuana makes reaction times slower. (marijuana_makes_reaction_times_slower)
47. I am more willing to do things that I normally would not do when I smoke marijuana. (do_things_normally_wouldnt_marijuana)
48. Smoking marijuana is similar to being 'high' from drinking alcohol. (marijuana_high_similar_to_alcohol)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation: The 48 items of the Marijuana Effect Expectancy Questionnaire (MEEQ) comprise the following 6 scales (Aarons et al., 2001): (1) Cognitive and Behavioral Impairment: items 14, 15, 17, 18, 21, 33, 36*, 40, 43, and 46 (2) Relaxation and Tension Reduction: items 4, 5, 6, 7, 10, 26, 42, and 44 (3) Social and Sexual Facilitation: items 8, 12, 13, 24, 27*, 31, 32*, 45, and 47 (4) Perceptual and Cognitive Enhancement: items 1, 9, 16, 19, 22, 26, 29, and 37 (5) Global Negative Effects: items 11, 23, 25, 28, 30, 34, 35, 38, and 48 (6) Craving and Physical Effects: items 2, 3, 20, 33, 39, and 41 The score for each scale is calculated by averaging the item scores, i.e., totaling the item scores and dividing by the number of items in the scale. Each item is scored on a 1 to 5 scale (Disagree Strongly = 1 and Agree Strongly = 5), except the items marked with an asterisk (*) which should be reversescored (Strongly Disagree = 5 and Strongly Agree = 1). Of note, item 26 appears on scales 2 and 4, and item 33 appears on scales 1 and 6. The scoring scheme reflects factors identified in the original publications. Factor structure may differ in individual studies. (scoring_520404)

protocol.longName: Expectancies - Alcohol, Tobacco, and Other Substances - Marijuana
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Marijuana Effect Expectancy Questionnaire (MEEQ) contains 78 items that describe the effects of marijuana on respondents. Respondents are asked to rate their experiences on a 5-point Likert scale to indicate agreement or disagreement. The MEEQ has 6 scales (6â€“13 items per scale) - Cognitive and Behavioral Impairment, Relaxation and Tension Reduction, Social and Sexual Facilitation, Perceptual and Cognitive Enhancement, Global Negative Effects, and Craving and Physical Effects. A shorter version of the MEEQ contains 48 items across the same 6 scales (6â€“10 items per scale).

form.longName: PhenX PX520306 - Selfreported Craving Specific Tobacco
form.preferredDefinition: The Brief Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU-Brief) consists of 10 statements about the respondent's feelings and thoughts about his or her desire to smoke cigarettes as he or she is completing the questionnaire (i.e., right now).

headerInstruction.text: Indicate how strongly you agree or disagree with each of the following statements by selecting a number between 1 (STRONGLY DISAGREE) and 7 (STRONGLY AGREE). The closer your selection to one end or the other indicates the strength of your agre..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: 1. I have a desire for a cigarette right now. (desire_for_a_cigarette)
2. Nothing would be better than smoking a cigarette right now. (nothing_better_than_smoking)
3. If it were possible, I probably would smoke right now. (would_smoke_now)
4. I could control things better right now if I could smoke. (control_things_better_smoke)
5. All I want right now is a cigarette. (all_i_want_is_cigarette)
6. I have an urge for a cigarette. (urge_for_a_cigarette)
7. A cigarette would taste good now. (a_cigarette_would_taste_good)
8. I would do almost anything for a cigarette now. (do_almost_anything_for_cigarette)
9. Smoking would make me less depressed. (smoking_make_me_less_depressed)
10. I am going to smoke as soon as possible. (smoke_as_soon_as_possible)

Scoring Procedure and Interpretation :Several scoring schemes have been proposed, and in all of these, the items are averaged or summed to yield factor scores. The initial scoring scheme proposed by Cox et al. (2001) and later partially confirmed by Toll et al. (2006) had two factors: *Factor 1 included items 1, 3, 6, 7, and 10 *Factor 2 included items 2, 4, 5, 8, and 9 The score for each factor is calculated by summing the item scores the total score is calculated by summing all 10 items. Toll et al. (2006) found that the most robust items from the Cox et al. (2001) analysis revealed the best fit in a confirmatory factor analysis, again with two factors: Factor 1 included items 1 and 6, and Factor 2 included items 4, 8, and 9. These items and factor titles are: Factor 1 Intention/Desire to Smoke .I have a desire for a cigarette right now. I have an urge for a cigarette. Factor 2 Relief of Negative Affect and Urgent Desire to Smoke .I could control things better right now if I could smoke. I would do almost anything for a cigarette right now. Smoking would make me less depressed. The scoring scheme reflects factors identified in the original publications. Factor structure may differ in individual studies (scoring_520306)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Brief Questionnaire of Smoking Urges (QSU-Brief) consists of 10 statements about the respondent's feelings and thoughts about his or her desire to smoke cigarettes as he or she is completing the questionnaire (i.e., right now).
